sourceText: Rosarium Philosophorum; Fama Fraternitatis; Chymical Wedding of Christian Rosenkreutz
note: The seven alchemical stages of the Great Work mapped to planets in Chaldean order. Each stage represents both a laboratory process and an inner transformation. The sequence moves from calcination (burning to prima materia) through to the crystallization of the Philosopher's Stone.

Saturn.description: Smelting to prima materia — burning away ego, attachments, and false structures to ash

Jupiter.description: Dissolving with water — liquefaction, the unconscious floods in, old structures wash away

Mars.description: Extracting the essential — analysis, cutting, dissecting, sorting what matters from what does not

Sun.description: Union of opposites — the sacred marriage of conscious and unconscious

Venus.description: Putrefaction, fermentation, rebirth, and soul awakening — the old self decays so the new can grow

Mercury.description: Purifying and elevating essence through vapor — repeated cycles of refining

Moon.description: Crystallizing the Philosopher's Stone — final solidification of the perfected substance
